raw_text:
Tory expert denies defeatism
 
 The Conservatives' campaign director has denied a report claiming he warned Michael Howard the party could not win the next general election.
 
 The Times on Monday said Australian Lynton Crosby told the party leader to focus on trying to increase the Tories' Commons presence by 25 to 30 seats. But Mr Crosby said in a statement: "I have never had any such conversation... and I do not hold that view." Mr Howard later added there was not "one iota" of truth in the report. The strategist helped Australia's PM, John Howard, win four elections. Mr Howard appointed Mr Crosby as his elections chief last October. Mr Crosby's statement said: "The Conservative Party has been making an impact on the issues of lower tax and controlled immigration over the past week." It added: "The Labour Party will be wanting to do all they can to distract attention away from the issues that really matter to people."
llama3.2:1b: Tory campaign director Tory expert denies a report claiming he warned Michael Howard the party could not win the next general election. The Times reported that Australian Lynton Crosby told Mr Howard to focus on increasing the Tories' Commons presence by 25-30 seats, but Crosby denied having such a conversation and said there was no truth in the report.
llama3.2:3b: Conservatives' campaign director Lynton Crosby denies warning Michael Howard that the party could not win the next general election, calling a report about such a conversation as untrue and stating he has made progress increasing the Tories' Commons presence by 25-30 seats.
gemma2:2b: Tory campaign director denies report claiming he warned Michael Howard party could not win next election. He says he has never had such a conversation and doesn't hold that view.  Michael Howard also states there is no truth in the report.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Key idea: The Conservatives' campaign director denied a report claiming he warned Michael Howard the party could not win the next general election. Key details: The Times reported on Monday, stating Australian politician Lynton Crosby told the party leader to focus on increasing the Tories' Commons presence by 25-30 seats. However, Mr. Crosby later stated, "I have never had any such conversation... and I do not hold that view." Similarly, Howard later added there was no truth in the report. The strategist helped Australia's Prime Minister John Howard win four more elections.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Conservative campaign director denies report suggesting he warned Michael Howard not to win next general election, stating he has never had such conversation and there is no truth in the claim.
qwen2.5:3b: Tory campaign director denies claims he told Michael Howard the party could not win next election. According to a report, Lynton Crosby suggested focusing on increasing Commons presence by 25-30 seats. Crosby denied this in a statement and said there was no truth in the claim. He also emphasized that the Conservatives had been making an impact with lower tax and controlled immigration issues, while Labour would attempt to divert attention from these core issues.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about a Tory expert denying defeatism. Let me read through it carefully first.

The text starts by saying that the Conservative campaign director has denied a report claiming he warned Michael Howard about a potential loss in the next election. I remember that defeatism is when you try to make people think you're losing, which can be bad for your reputation. So if someone denies defeatism, maybe they believe the party isn't really doing their best.

Next, the Times on Monday reported that Lynton Crosby told Michael Howard to focus on increasing the Tories' presence in the Commons by 25 to 30 seats. I know the MPs vote for their seats, so this is about getting more of them. But Crosby said he never had a conversation about it before and doesn't agree with the idea. He later admitted that the report was false.

Then, Howard appointed him as head of elections last October, aiming to distract people from real issues. The statement he made highlighted the party's progress on tax and immigration but compared Labour's focus to distractions away from real problems. This could show that while the campaign director is focused on his own issues, there might be underlying issues with the party.

Putting this together, it seems like the expert is saying the Conservative Party isn't doing enough for its issues—taxes and immigration. They need more seats in parliament but aren't preparing to do so. The report about Howard's election strategy was fake, which could undermine his efforts and create mistrust among supporters.

I should make sure the summary captures all key points: the expert denying defeatism, the report about Howard's election focus being fake, and the underlying issues with the party on tax and immigration.
</think>

Tory experts deny defeatism over Conservative campaign director's claims. They report that Lynton Crosby told Michael Howard to increase Tories' seat numbers in parliament. However, he said no such conversation exists and denies the report about his strategy. Howard made a statement highlighting the party's progress on issues but compared Labour's efforts to distraction as part of their tactics.
tinyllama:1.1b: In a sharp rebuttal to a report claiming a warning of defeatism by Conservative party strategist Lynton Crosby, Timothy Tory director of the Australian Liberal Party said Crobjy had never held such views. In his statement to The Times on Monday, Tory denied the claim and stated that it was not true. Tory's statement clarified that he did not hold such a view. Crobjy added that Mr Howard appointed him as the party's elections chief in October last year. This comment highlighted how the Conservative Party has been making an impact on the issue of lower tax and controlled immigration, according to the statement. Labour is also focusing on distracting attention away from issues that matter to people, but Crobjy emphasized that it was the Liberal Party's goal to "bring about" change in Australia.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Tory expert denies defeatism, says he warned Michael Howard that party could not win general election.

Australian strategist Lynton Crosby denied a report that claims he warned Michael Howard's Conservative Party that it couldn't win the next general election. Mr. Crosby claimed in an statement that there is "no one iota" of truth in the report and added: "I do not hold that view." The strategist was appointed by Australian Prime Minister John Howard as elections chief last October.
phi:2.7b: Tory expert denies defeatism, as Australian Lynton Crosby did not warn Michael Howard about losing the next general election. The report suggested he told Howard to focus on increasing their presence in Parliament by 25-30 seats, but Crosby denied this and said there was no truth to it. He praised the Conservative Party's efforts in addressing lower taxes and immigration issues.
orca-mini:3b: Tory expert denies defeatism as reported by The Times, saying he never had a conversation with Michael Howard about trying to win the next general election by increasing the Conservatives' Commons presence by 25-30 seats. Mr. Crosby said this in a statement, adding that there was no truth to the report. Mr. Howard later denied the report's accuracy. Mr. Crosby's statement emphasized that the Conservative Party has been focused on issues of lower tax and controlled immigration during the past week. The Labour Party is expected to focus on these issues as well to distract attention away from the important issues.
hermes3:3b: Conservatives' campaign director denies predicting electoral defeat.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Conservatives' campaign director denies report claiming he warned Michael Howard that the party could not win the next general election. Australian Lynton Crosby said he never had such a conversation and doesn't hold that view. Michael Howard dismissed the report as having "one iota" of truth. The strategist helped Australia's PM, John Howard, win four elections and was appointed by him as his elections chief last October.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Conservative campaign director Lynton Crosby denied a report claiming he told party leader Michael Howard they could not win the next election, instead advising a focus on gaining 25 to 30 seats. Crosby stated he never had such a conversation and did not hold that view. Howard also dismissed the report as false. Crosby, who previously helped Australia's PM John Howard win four elections, emphasized the Conservatives' focus on lower taxes and controlled immigration, accusing Labour of trying to divert attention from key issues.
stablelm2:1.6b: Conservative campaign director denies report claiming he warned Michael Howard about party not winning general election. Strategist Lynton Crosby denied conversation with Howard about increasing Tories' seats and claimed he has never had such a conversation. Mr. Howard added there was no truth in the report, while Mr. Crosby stated that the Conservative Party is making an impact on lower tax and controlled immigration issues. Labour Party aims to distract attention from these matters.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Conservatives' campaign director, Lynton Crosby, refutes claims in The Times report stating he advised party leader Michael Howard to expect a limited gain of 25-30 Commons seats in the next election. In a statement, Mr. Crosby denied having such a conversation and expressed no such belief. He highlighted the party's recent progress on lower taxes and controlled immigration. Prime Minister John Howard corroborated this, asserting there was "no truth" to the allegations.
reference: Mr Howard appointed Mr Crosby as his elections chief last October.Mr Crosby's statement said: "The Conservative Party has been making an impact on the issues of lower tax and controlled immigration over the past week."Mr Howard later added there was not "one iota" of truth in the report.But Mr Crosby said in a statement: "I have never had any such conversation... and I do not hold that view."
